DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate long-term safety tolerability rapastinel adjunctive antidepressant therapy ( ADT ) patient major depressive disorder ( MDD ) .
DOC.brief_title: Long-term Safety Study Rapastinel Adjunctive Therapy Patients With Major Depressive Disorder
DOC.criteria: Meet Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders , Fifth Edition ( DSM5 ) criteria MDD Current major depressive episode least 8 week exceed 18 month duration Screening Have partial response ( < 50 % improvement ) ongoing treatment protocolallowed antidepressant If female childbearing potential , negative serum βhuman chorionic gonadotropin ( βhCG ) pregnancy test . DSM5based diagnosis disorder MDD primary focus treatment within 6 month Screening Lifetime history meeting DSM5 criterion : 1 . Schizophrenia spectrum psychotic disorder 2 . Bipolar relate disorder 3 . Major neurocognitive disorder 4 . Neurodevelopmental disorder great mild severity severity impact participant 's ability consent , follow study direction , otherwise safely participate study 5 . Dissociative disorder 6 . Posttraumatic stress disorder 7 . MDD psychotic feature Significant suicide risk , judge Investigator .
